Class WorkloadParser

java.lang.Object
Utils.WorkloadParser
public class WorkloadParser extends Object
WorkloadParser serves as the client-side simulation tool for the microservices It reads service commands from a workload text file, translates them into JSON-formatted HTTP requests, and dispatches them to the OrderService (act as a gateway)

    static void
    handleOrder(String[] parts)
    Processes order specific workload commands and maps them to appropriate HTTP methods The method supports the following command structures 1: Triggers a POST request to create a new order (product_id, user_id and quantity) 2: Triggers a GET request to retrieve existing order details 3: Triggers a DELETE request to remove an order from the system

    Executes an HTTP POST request to the OrderService gateway with a JSON payload This method set the Content-Type header to application/json, ensuring that the receiving service correctly interprets the body as a JSON object.

  • Constructor Details

    • WorkloadParser

      public WorkloadParser()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException, InterruptedException, URISyntaxException
      Entry point for the workload simulation Parse the command line for the workload file path, initializes network coordinates, and enters a processing loop to execute commands line by line
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments. arg[0] should be the path to the workload.txt file
      Throws:
      IOException - If the workload file or configuration cannot read
      InterruptedException - If the HTTP request process is interrupted
      URISyntaxException - If the generated URLs are invalid

    • handleUser

      public static void handleUser(String command, String[] parts) throws IOException, URISyntaxException, InterruptedException
      Parses USER commands (create, get, update and delete) and generates the appropriate JSON payload for the gateway.
      Parameters:
      command - The specific action to perform (for example, 'create')
      parts - The full array of command arguments from the workload file
      Throws:
      IOException - If the request dispatch fails
      URISyntaxException - If the URI is invalid
      InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted

    • handleOrder

      public static void handleOrder(String[] parts) throws IOException, URISyntaxException, InterruptedException
      Processes order specific workload commands and maps them to appropriate HTTP methods The method supports the following command structures 1: Triggers a POST request to create a new order (product_id, user_id and quantity) 2: Triggers a GET request to retrieve existing order details 3: Triggers a DELETE request to remove an order from the system
      Parameters:
      parts - An array of strings parsed from the workload file line. Expected format: [service, action, arg1, arg2, arg3]
      Throws:
      IOException - If the connection to the OrderService fails
      URISyntaxException - If the constructed URI is malformed
      InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response

    • sendDeleteRequest

      public static void sendDeleteRequest(String endpoint)
      Executes a HTTP DELETE request to a specific endpoint on the OrderService. This method is primarily used for canceling existing orders. It constructs the target URI, removes whitespace, and dispatches the request using the shared HttpClient
      Parameters:
      endpoint - The relative path for the deletion target (for example: "/order/1000")

    • handleProduct

      public static void handleProduct(String command, String[] parts) throws IOException, URISyntaxException, InterruptedException
      Throws:
      IOException
      URISyntaxException
      InterruptedException

    • sendGetRequest

      public static void sendGetRequest(String endpoint) throws IOException, InterruptedException, URISyntaxException
      Send an HTTP GET request to the OrderService gateway This method waits for the response string and logs both the status code and the body to the console
      Parameters:
      endpoint - endpoint the resource (For example, /user/1009)
      Throws:
      IOException - If a network error occurs during transmission
      InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while waiting for the response
      URISyntaxException - If the concatenated URL creates an invalid URI structure

    • sendPostRequest

      public static void sendPostRequest(String endpoint, String jsonBody)
      Executes an HTTP POST request to the OrderService gateway with a JSON payload This method set the Content-Type header to application/json, ensuring that the receiving service correctly interprets the body as a JSON object. It logs the target endpoint, the resulting HTTP status code, and the response body to the standard output
      Parameters:
      endpoint - endpoint the relative API path (for example, "/user" or "/order")
      jsonBody - The string which represent a JSON object containing the command and data
